questions.question_text:
A customer has an existing WAN circuit with a capacity of 10 Mbps. The circuit has 6 Mbps of various user traffic and 5 Mbps of real-time audio traffic on average.
Which two measures could be taken to avoid loss of real time traffic? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Ensure that real time traffic is prioritized over other traffic.
choices.A: Police the traffic to 3.3 Mbps and allow excess traffic to be remarked to the default queue.
choices.B: Configure congestion avoidance mechanism WRED within the priority queue.
choices.D: Police the traffic to 5 Mbps and allow excess traffic to be remarked to the default queue.

discussion.content: c and e are the ans

comments.content:
I believe that would be contrary to the requested, as total real time traffic would not be prioritized and could be lost. Assuming 11Mbps is the company's current requirements for operation the circuit needs an upgrade, in addition to prioritizing real time data transit.
My opinion only.

discussion.content: Based on Arch book, A&E are correct

D - VXLAN
NSX is vmware solition

questions.question_text: An engineer has proposed the deployment of a Cisco ACI fabric solution to introduce automation and zero-touch operation experience to a DC network. Which type of virtualization technology is utilized by the Cisco ACI to encapsulate the traffic inside the fabric and to virtualize the physical infrastructure?

choices.C: It adds arbitrary forwarding topologies on top of a fixed routed underlay topology.
choices.B: It removes the need for Hot Standby Router Protocol.
choices.A: It removes the need to configure redundant switches with identical policies.
choices.E: It is capable of supporting live migration of virtual machines as they move from one physical server to another. AB
choices.D: Each switch has a separate control plane.

questions.question_text: A network engineer is evaluating an architecture that utilizes VSS for the data center module. Which two advantages of using VSS technology are true? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Configure hub-and-spoke areas as totally stubby.
choices.C: Use External Type 2 metric across the OSPF domain.
choices.B: Implement summarization on the ASBR routers in the backbone area.
choices.E: Implement summarization on the ABR routers of hub-and-spoke areas.

questions.question_text: An engineer is designing an OSPF network with multiple nonbackbone areas connected to the backbone area via a hub-and-spoke topology. Each hub-and-spoke topology has a large number of spoke routers connected to the hub that is functioning as an ABR to provide better segmentation. Which two actions improve the stability of this design? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: D and E for me - ARCH book says totally stubby and ABR also no mention of ASBR and re-distribution but might be missing a trick
I think D and E are correct

comments.content:
There's an almost exact same scenario at chpt 26 of Designing for Cisco Network Service Architectures (ARCH) Foundation Learning Guide, Fourth Edition. It states

"Because the branches in this scenario do not have any other exit but the hub, it is safe and advisable to deploy each branch network as a totally stubby area. With this design (see Figure 26-3), each branch router will receive only the default route from the backbone (border routers of the branch)."
Makes sense. D and E work for me too.

questions.question_text: Which two characteristics of MSDP when designing an interdomain multicast network are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
answers are A&B: for the link in the question 
- MSDP is a mechanism that allows RPs to share information about active sources
- In the PIM-SM model, multicast sources and receivers must register with their local RP
D is wrong because from the same source RPs in other domains have no way of knowing about sources located in other domains
I think the correct answers should be A and D. Though C is a correct statement, but D is more relevant to MSDP.

choices.E: The MSDP speaker periodically sends SAs that include all sources in all discovered domains.
choices.C: In the PIM-SM model, multicast sources and receivers must register with their local RP.
choices.D: RPs in other domains have full knowledge of sources located in other domains.
choices.B: Any network utilizing iBGP or eBGP can use MSDP.
choices.A: MSDP is a mechanism that allows RPs to share information about active sources.
